newsitem.title: USA: Insured Municipal fund sees correction.
newsitem.headline: Insured Municipal fund sees correction.

text.p: Insured Municipal Income Fund Inc said Friday it expected a technical correction in the municipal bond market before it continues its positive course.
The fund, which mostly holds long-term municipal bonds, said it will continue to diversify across the yield curve to lessen interest-rate risk.
As of July 31, the fund portfolio's biggest municipal bond holdings by state were Illinois (15.9 percent), Texas (11.0), Pennsylvania (9.6), Rhode Island (7.1) and Nevada (5.8).
Its top five secor holdings were power (21.9 percent), water (20.5), health care (18.8), sales tax (12.0), general obligations (9.7).
The portfolio's weighted maturity averaged 22.19 years; the weighted duration 5.65 years; the weighted coupon 5.86 percant; and AMT paper 0 percent.
